intro: Coreopsis cajamarcana, commonly known as the Andean coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and has slender, hairy stems with alternate leaves. Its flowers bloom in late summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Coreopsis cajamarcana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
